intro: Plectaneia elastica var. inutilis, commonly known as the rubber vine, is a tropical plant characterized by its elastic, latex-rich stems. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of South America. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a smooth, waxy surface and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its unique ability to exude a milky sap makes it valuable in traditional medicine and industrial applications. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some areas due to its rapid growth and ecological impact.
